text: That wasn't good but at least the artwork was interesting.

name: clintisiceman
text:
You're right. It does have that going for it. But it so painful to look at. The dude really thought he got Roast Beef and thought he was making a super cool in-character joke. But it is so wrong and lame. It fails on at least 6 levels.

At least this strip was just the writer doing whatever the fuck he wanted and not worrying at all about trying to mimic Onstad's voice and having the characters behave like they do. I can at least respect that.

name: neonaoneo
text: A comment left by neonaoneo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ppccd, Jeet, theplaidknight)

name: waddlerz
text: Besides the poor drawing/animal animation, I actually like the last panel

name: ovenface
text: There are things I like about this strip. I like how Ray has no eyes under his glasses, which is true . I like how it perpetuates the morphing of Lyle's mouth into a moustache, I like how stupid it is, and I enjoy how ray seems to be a giant ball of dough that is melting towards the floor until a air vent turns on underneath his feet in panel 5. His doughy arms all flapping in the breeze. It's certainly no achewood strip, but I can enjoy a dumb sight gag now and again. You can't expect someone's interpretation of a thing to be exactly like the real thing. It's like a punk rock cover of a song you liked. All raw and shitty, but you can appreciate that someone else likes the song enough to do a cover.

name: excusemesenator
text: But Ray does have eyes, as shown during his trip to hell. Can't you.... SEE?

name: ovenface
text: yeah, but that's in hell! maybe you get back your old body parts in the afterlife.

name: agentstinky
text: I mean I'm kinda surprised it's not rated higher; no, it's not like normal Achewoods, but it's a guest strip and it's supposed to be parodying old-time comics where the jokes were really simple and stupid and people needed to have parts of their body pop off just to show how surprised they were.

name: snowman
text: You got it.

name: autrepoupee
text: yeah, that's definitely how I see it, too.  I was surprised at the rating and comments.  Then again, I have a softspot for old-timeys and parodies of such things.

name: boredom_man

I got the flip-take
I also got herpes simplex 2

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Exactly. Thank you. Orphan Annie eyes, gullible faces, Teodor re-inventing the common damn umbrella- boom! absurd punchline. This guy is a crassftsman deluxe.
It is a perfect strip in its universe, which is far closer to maybe Zap comix than to Achewood, but still....Plus, fwiw, I will bet you Onstadt laffed his but of at it.

Off to old-time comix appreciation class, the rest of you!

name: spenham
text: :( Teodor's pants keep changing colors...

name: snowman
text:
Man, I rated this one a 4 before I read any comments, and I gotta say, I'm kinda surprised, guys. Sam Henderson is a brilliant cartoonist. Maybe it's just because I've read his stuff a bunch before, but I thought this strip was really offbeat and funny. It's ridiculous, sure, but...Jesus, get with it, people, you're Achewood fans.

Separate point about the drawing: let's not forget that Onstad uses sort of a cut-and-paste technique to keep his characters looking so consistent. I think if Chris drew freehand, Achewood would probably look less well-drawn than this strip.

name: featurelessvoid
text: I'm working on some fixes to Assetbarista, related specifically to the display of Unicode in newly posted comments.  In order to sort out this code, I'll have to make several test posts.  Therefore I'm posting to the lowest-rated comic in the archive, in hopes that my fellow Assetbards will find my testing forgivable.
